metadata.title: CVE-2023-0836 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An information leak vulnerability was discovered in HAProxy 2.1, 2.2 before2.2.27, 2.3, 2.4 before 2.4.21, 2.5 before 2.5.11, 2.6 before 2.6.8, 2.7before 2.7.1. There are 5 bytes left uninitialized in the connection bufferwhen encoding the FCGI_BEGIN_REQUEST record. Sensitive data may bedisclosed to configured FastCGI backends in an unexpected way.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0836` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

haproxy - 2.4.18-0ubuntu1.3
vim-haproxy - 2.4.18-0ubuntu1.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: haproxy package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.18-0ubuntu1.3').
